file_content.text: I have the last platform under control.
That's it, then. Let's hope for the best.
The laser drill is at full power. We're following your program.
Platforms one and two are fully functional. Accelerating destabilization of the Makeb planetary core.
The Hutts are reporting Pelratha Mesa just collapsed. Tell me this is working!
No interruptions, please. Doctor Cherush?
Narrowing beam by point-oh-two percent. We've got magma flooding the drill shaft!
Running projections. The core will reach equilibrium shortly; Makeb will remain intact.
Be proud, all of you. This planet was about to die--but today, we overcame death itself.
Well done. We saved Makeb.
Don't be so proud of doing what's expected. You followed orders and achieved a bare minimum of success.
You obeyed my commands.
You've made mistakes before. You're absolutely certain the core will stabilize?
How sure are you?
Apologies, of course.
This is station one! One of our stabilizers burst!
Fine, now let us go. We can get offworld and never bother you again. Please.
We have reached consensus with all consulting Science Bureau members.
Then it worked.
You did what was asked, and there's no point in dying. Get to safety--but understand this:
Go. You've earned your lives.
The job is not done until the planet stops shaking. Your lives are nothing next to Makeb; remind yourselves of that when the platforms break apart.
Remain at your posts!
Tell anyone what happened, and the Hutts will find out. If they know Makeb is safe, they'll never give up your world.
We won't spread it around. Thank you.
I will maintain control of the drills remotely as the planet stabilizes. I should be able to prevent this continent from collapsing.
My lord! Message from Darth Marr, but I'm getting interference....
Sir! Message from Darth Marr, but I'm getting interference....
The Republic and Hutt fleets are abandoning the Makeb system. They report that the planet is in its death throes.
This is all according to plan.
The last time you called, you thought I had failed. Don't make that mistake again.
You shouldn't have doubted me.
Our enemies cannot comprehend our designs. They believe the Empire has fallen, but victory is ours.
We played them for fools.
Lord Marr. Allow me to present the Empire's newest resource world.
Makeb belongs to me now.
You brought me on board to run a covert operation. I've kept our cover intact.
Secrecy is paramount.
Never trust a Hutt. You put a bounty on Makeb, I'm delivering the planet--intact.
You hired me, I did my part.
All glory to the Emperor.
I will continue to instruct the drill teams. I should be able to control the tremors sufficiently to prevent this continent from collapsing.
Makeb is stable. Prepare a force to claim it.
When the last Republic and Hutt ships have fled, I will send my fleet to secure the planet.
Makeb will be ours within the week. Well done, Wrath.
Makeb is stable, and it is mine, no matter what our enemies believe. Prepare a force to claim it.
Very well. When the Republic and Hutt ships have fled, I will have my fleet secure the system.
I admit--I underestimated your endgame.
All evidence to the contrary, Makeb is stable. You need only bring a force to claim it.
Our methods are not alike. Still, you have done well.
Then the world is stable? Impressive.
Makeb has been stabilized. The Republic and the Hutts just don't know it.
Impressive. Then we must keep your secret.
I have a fleet positioned several light-years away. When the last Republic and Hutt ships have fled Makeb, mine will secure the system.
Within the week, Makeb will be ours.
It appears the isotope-5 fluctuations are exacerbating Makeb's atmospheric interference. It will take some time to restore offworld communications.
Do what you have to. I won't be isolated from the rest of the galaxy down here.
Get to work. I want Marr back.
I will attempt delicate core manipulations to suit your needs. I'm afraid the results will not be immediate.
If people can't communicate off-planet, the chances of the truth spreading are minimal.
So Makeb is isolated? Good.
Agreed. Could be a boon.
No rush to restore communications. Let Lord Marr stew awhile.
I was done with Marr anyway.
Acknowledged.
When you're good to travel, we can meet back here. Celebrate and sleep.
Indeed.
